context:
The man turned on the faucet, therefore
Choices:
A. the toilet filled with water.
B. water flowed from the spout.

The girl found a bug in her cereal, therefore
Choices:
A. she poured milk in the bowl.
B. she lost her appetite.

The woman retired, therefore
Choices:
A. she received her pension.
B. she paid off her mortgage.

I wanted to conserve energy, therefore
Choices:
A. i swept the floor in the unoccupied room.
B. i shut off the light in the unoccupied room.

The hamburger meat browned, because
Choices:
A. the cook froze it.
B. the cook grilled it.

I doubted the salesman's pitch, therefore
Choices:
A. i turned his offer down.
B. he persuaded me to buy the product.

I decided to stay home for the night, because
Choices:
A. the forecast called for storms.
B. my friends urged me to go out.

My eyes became red and puffy, because
Choices:
A. i was sobbing.
B. i was laughing.

The flame on the candle went out, because
Choices:
A. i blew on the wick.
B. i put a match to the wick.

The man drank heavily at the party, therefore
Choices:
A. he had a headache the next day.
B. he had a runny nose the next day.

The bowling ball knocked over the bowling pins, because
Choices:
A. the man rolled the bowling ball down the alley.
B. the man dropped the bowling ball on his foot.

The community learned of the man's death, because
Choices:
A. his family buried him in the cemetery.
B. his obituary appeared in the newspaper.

My computer crashed, therefore
Choices:
A. i installed new speakers.
B. i lost all my data.

The woman resigned from her job, because
Choices:
A. she aspired to hold an executive position in the firm.
B. she believed her superiors were acting unethically.

The player caught the ball, because
Choices:
A. her teammate threw it to her.
B. her opponent tried to intercept it.

The judge pounded the gavel, because
Choices:
A. the courtroom broke into uproar.
B. the jury announced its verdict.

The woman banished the children from her property, because
Choices:
A. the children hit a ball into her yard.
B. the children trampled through her garden.

The kidnappers released the hostage, because
Choices:
A. they accepted ransom money.
B. they escaped from jail.

The cook's eyes watered, because
Choices:
A. he ran out of onions.
B. he cut an onion.

The woman ran her finger under cold water, because
Choices:
A. she burned her finger on the toaster.
B. she put a diamond ring on her finger.

The student misspelled the word, therefore
Choices:
A. the teacher corrected her.
B. the teacher dismissed her.

I regained composure from my fit of anger, because
Choices:
A. my heart pounded.
B. i took deep breaths.

I put my hands under the running faucet, therefore
Choices:
A. the soap rinsed off my hands.
B. the water splashed in my face.

The man dressed in his best suit, because
Choices:
A. he scheduled a meeting with an important client.
B. his wife bought him a new tie.

The man confessed his love for the woman, therefore
Choices:
A. the woman rejected him.
B. the woman envied him.

The driver got a flat tire, because
Choices:
A. he went over the speed limit.
B. he ran over a nail.

My view of the movie screen was blocked, because
Choices:
A. the couple behind me was whispering.
B. a tall person was sitting in front of me.

The driver turned on the car's headlights, because
Choices:
A. he heard thunder.
B. the sun went down.

The girl refused to eat her vegetables, therefore
Choices:
A. her father told her to drink her milk.
B. her father took away her dessert.

The woman covered her mouth with her hand, because
Choices:
A. she exhaled.
B. she sneezed.

The secretary put the caller on hold, therefore
Choices:
A. the caller's phone lost reception.
B. the caller waited on the line.

The woman walked with crutches, because
Choices:
A. she shaved her legs.
B. she broke her leg.

I coughed, because
Choices:
A. i inhaled smoke.
B. i lowered my voice.

The clock chimed, because
Choices:
A. it was the top of the hour.
B. the hour seemed to drag on.

The chef hit the egg on the side of the bowl, therefore
Choices:
A. the egg cracked.
B. the egg rotted.

The police searched the offender's car, because
Choices:
A. they were trying to elicit a confession.
B. they were looking for illegal drugs.

The couple travelled south for the winter, because
Choices:
A. they were retired.
B. they were separated.

The man felt obligated to attend the event, because
Choices:
A. he turned down his friend's invitation to go.
B. he promised his friend that he would go.

The bride got cold feet before the wedding, therefore
Choices:
A. the wedding guests brought gifts.
B. she called the wedding off.

The man grew old, therefore
Choices:
A. his hair turned gray.
B. he sold his belongings.

The friends decided to share the hamburger, therefore
Choices:
A. they cut the hamburger in half.
B. they ordered fries with the hamburger.

I twisted the cap off the soda bottle, therefore
Choices:
A. the soda fizzed.
B. the soda leaked out.

The pair of students came under scrutiny by the teacher, because
Choices:
A. the students both received excellent grades.
B. their responses on the assignment were identical.

The student was in a rush to get to school on time, therefore
Choices:
A. he left his assignment at home.
B. he brought his lunch to school.

The journalist wrote a biography about the humanitarian's life, because
Choices:
A. the humanitarian was difficult for the journalist to interview.
B. the journalist was intrigued by the humanitarian's work.

The man defied the authorities of the church, therefore
Choices:
A. he donated money to the church.
B. he was excommunicated from the church.

The woman's hair fell in her face, therefore
Choices:
A. she pulled her hair back with a clip.
B. she lathered shampoo into her hair.

The ring on my finger got stuck, because
Choices:
A. my finger swelled.
B. i chipped my fingernail.

I pulled the rubber band, therefore
Choices:
A. it flung across the room.
B. it stretched.

I pressed my hand into the wet cement, therefore
Choices:
A. my handprint dried in the cement.
B. cracks emerged in the cement.

My skin broke out into a rash, because
Choices:
A. i brushed against poison ivy in my yard.
B. i eradicated the poison ivy from my yard.

My subscription to the magazine expired, therefore
Choices:
A. i discarded the new issue.
B. i stopped receiving new issues.

The detective revealed an anomaly in the case, therefore
Choices:
A. he finalized his theory.
B. he scrapped his theory.

The boy threw a temper tantrum, because
Choices:
A. his brother took his toys from him.
B. he shared his toys with his brother.

The child learned how to read, because
Choices:
A. he began attending school.
B. he skipped a grade in school.

The boy skipped dinner, because
Choices:
A. his mother cooked his favorite meal.
B. he ate a big lunch.

The woman lavished her friend with flattery, because
Choices:
A. she wanted to ask her friend for a favor.
B. she was irritated with her friend's whining.

The key was missing from my pants pocket, because
Choices:
A. the pocket had a hole.
B. the pants were new.

The man fainted, because
Choices:
A. he took a nap.
B. he ran a marathon.

The man lost the competition, because
Choices:
A. the competition was sabotaged.
B. he intimidated his competitors.

The mother called an ambulance, because
Choices:
A. her son lost his cat.
B. her son fell out of his bed.

The driver slammed on his brakes, because
Choices:
A. a deer appeared on the road.
B. the car radio shut off.

The lock opened, because
Choices:
A. i turned the key in the lock.
B. i made a duplicate of the key.

I put rubber gloves on, because
Choices:
A. i was preparing to wash my hands.
B. i was preparing to clean the bathroom.

The animal species became endangered, because
Choices:
A. their habitat was destroyed.
B. their predators went extinct.

The man perceived that the woman looked different, because
Choices:
A. the woman got her hair cut.
B. the woman wore a bracelet.

The student forgot to do her assignment, therefore
Choices:
A. she made up an excuse to tell the teacher.
B. the teacher promoted her to the next grade.

The dog barked, because
Choices:
A. the cat lounged on the couch.
B. a knock sounded at the door.

Plans were announced to replace a local park with a shopping mall, therefore
Choices:
A. environmentalists started a petition.
B. environmentalists produced a documentary.

The couple was happy to see each other, therefore
Choices:
A. they kissed.
B. they rested.

The woman asked the man to leave, because
Choices:
A. he insulted her.
B. he thanked her.

The tree branch landed in the river, therefore
Choices:
A. the branch moved downstream.
B. the river's current became stronger.

The teacher assigned homework to the students, therefore
Choices:
A. the students passed notes.
B. the students groaned.

The seasons changed from summer to autumn, therefore
Choices:
A. people evacuated their homes.
B. leaves fell from the trees.

The politician was convicted of fraud, therefore
Choices:
A. he campaigned for re-election.
B. he was removed from office.

I pushed the wagon, therefore
Choices:
A. the objects in the wagon fell out.
B. the wagon wheels spun forward.

The lobbyist persuaded the legislature to support the bill, therefore
Choices:
A. the president vetoed the bill.
B. the legislature passed the bill.

My closet was messy, therefore
Choices:
A. i organized it.
B. i decorated it.

I stayed up late, therefore
Choices:
A. i had vivid dreams that night.
B. i was tired in the morning.

The man's pocket jingled as he walked, because
Choices:
A. his pocket was filled with coins.
B. he sewed the hole in his pocket.

Everyone in the class turned to stare at the student, because
Choices:
A. the student's phone rang.
B. the student took notes.

The horse bucked, because
Choices:
A. a fly bit the horse.
B. the rider stroked the horse.

The jewelry thieves were caught, therefore
Choices:
A. the stolen jewelry was returned to its owners.
B. the cost of the stolen jewelry was calculated.

Political violence broke out in the nation, therefore
Choices:
A. many citizens relocated to the capitol.
B. many citizens took refuge in other territories.

The woman was arrested, because
Choices:
A. she checked into rehab.
B. she committed assault.

The woman read the newspaper, therefore
Choices:
A. she discovered the outcome of the election.
B. she casted a vote in the election.

The sick child coughed on his friend, therefore
Choices:
A. his friend got sick.
B. his friend sneezed.

The couple got engaged, therefore
Choices:
A. they planned a wedding.
B. they took some time apart.

The woman contacted the real estate agent, because
Choices:
A. the woman planned to buy a condo.
B. the woman needed to clean her house.

The man won the lottery, therefore
Choices:
A. he became rich.
B. he owed money.

I lit the candle, therefore
Choices:
A. wax dripped off the candle.
B. the wax on the candle hardened.

I spent the day at the pool, therefore
Choices:
A. i sprained my ankle.
B. my face got sunburned.

The man received a parking ticket, because
Choices:
A. he parallel parked on the street.
B. the parking meter expired.

The woman became famous, therefore
Choices:
A. photographers followed her.
B. her family avoided her.

The girl wanted to wear earrings, therefore
Choices:
A. she got her ears pierced.
B. she got a tattoo.

My ears were ringing, because
Choices:
A. i went to a museum.
B. i went to a concert.

I tidied up my house, because
Choices:
A. i was swamped with work.
B. i was expecting company.

The airline mishandled my luggage, therefore
Choices:
A. they offered me compensation.
B. they cancelled my flight.

The computer was expensive to fix, therefore
Choices:
A. i got it repaired.
B. i bought a new one.

The woman was in a bad mood, therefore
Choices:
A. she engaged in small talk with her friend.
B. she told her friend to leave her alone.
